channel.title: Questions about installing Whonix KVM
channel.description:
Hi,
1. The requirements for the graphical environment for the host machine are [not specified here](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/System_Requirements#Non-Qubes-Whonix_System_Requirements). Does it require a graphical environment, or is a minimal console option enough?
2. In this [Instruction](http://www.dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion/wiki/KVM#Debian), during the installation of Whonix KVM, it is proposed to execute 2 reboot commands. Is this mandatory? Maybe one reboot command is enough?

item.title: Questions about installing Whonix KVM
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Peele:

The requirements for the graphical environment for the host machine are not specified here.
Does it require a graphical environment, or is a minimal console option enough?

As I already said in the other thread, you can use KVM and the Whonix Kicksecure VMs on top of it headlessly without a GUI on either the host or the guest.

Peele:

In this Instruction, during the installation of Whonix KVM, it is proposed to execute 2 reboot commands.
Is this mandatory? Maybe one reboot command is enough?

I can’t remember. Try it and report back. I don’t think it is that inconvenient.
